result.execSummary:
The defendant David M. Ziebell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Can be discharged early at the discretion of the department if he has been in compliance of the rules and all other respects.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant David M. Ziebell in court with attorney Eric Sheets. Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  
Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
Count 2 - NO CONTEST
Count 3 - NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorney stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty Counts 2 & 3.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Count 1 is dismissed and read-in. 

Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Sheets makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT: 
Count 2 - 
Imposed and Stayed - 135 days in jail -
Placed on probation for a period of 24 months:
Engage in any counseling deemed appropriate by the agent. 
Maintain absolute sobriety at the agents discretion.
No abusive contact with the Victim, Ms. Lonconto. 
Write letter of apology to the victim, to go to the agent within the first 30 days to review and forward. 
Obtain and maintain  fulltime employment
Pay $200 fine plus costs including the domestic abuse surcharge and DNA surcharge. 
Serve 20 days in jail with 1 day jail credit.
Huber for employment and any counseling he may be involved in.
Sentence to commence within 60 days. 
Must report today for start date and time. 
Can be discharged early at the discretion of the department if he has been in compliance of the rules and all other respects. 

Count 3 - 
Imposed and Stayed - 75 days in jail, concurrent with Count 2, with 1 day credit -
Placed on probation for a period of 24 months:
Comply with all conditions set forth in Count 2. 
Pay costs including the domestic abuse and DNA surcharges. 
Any bond that has been posted is to be applied. 
Can be discharged early at the discretion of the department if he has been in compliance of the rules and all other respects.
Plea hearing on September 16, 2014 at 02:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on August 25, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant David M. Ziebell in court with attorney Eric P. Sheets. Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives right to Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions the Defendant regarding Waiver of Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions Defendant's attorney.
Court finds the Defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the Preliminary Hearing.
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

  Arraignment:
State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 
Not Guilty Plea entered.
Bond Continued
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 25, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on July 21, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant David M. Ziebell in court with attorney Eric P Sheets. ADA Isherwood appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.
Time limits waived.
Bond continued.
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 21, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
CAP Services: Personalized Family Safety Plan with consent to contact filed by: Mary Ann Joy Lontoco

$1,000 cash bond:  
  Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.   Do not have direct/indirect contact with the following persons/places:  Mary Ann Joy Lontoco  *Unless a written request  from the victim and a Family Safety Plan is filed with the District Attorney and the Clerk of Courts.  If filed, then no abusive contact with the above named.
